content:
How can I edit the contents of the yellow publish box that appears at the top of every page? I'm publishing an IG for use in NZ, and just want it to say something like "Published by HL7 New Zealand". It seems to be populated by the IG Publisher, not sure where that can be adjusted...

Alternatively, can it be removed?
Additionally - is it possible to remove the QA link from the footer of each page?
The publish box gets populated automatically by the publication process when you make a release
Is that what you want?
https://confluence.hl7.org/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=104580055
Well, I'm not formally 'releasing' the IG - I'm just building the IG locally, then copying the pages to a server. Is there a better way?
Just checked that link - guess it's more complicated than I thought. sigh.
step 5 - is the ig-root folder the output folder - ie the IG contents?
No, it's actually the same folder as the IG itself
(that procedure is in case you release the IG by copying it to another place
sorry "same folder as the IG itself" - when I run locally, the IG appears in a folder called "output" - where is the ig root?
TBH - all I want to do is change the publish box contents - everything else was working fine!
I just went through that recently by automating it. Let me check the simpler process
The IG root folder is the folder that contains input, output, etc.
but everything is not working fine, as you'll find over time. The complicated release process exists for a reason
I have a tool that can manually update the publish box in a folder if you want to use it @David Hay

speaking of publish box: when we publish with a github action (not the HL7 CI build) we still see the "this is the local development build".
Can we change that?
there's more to getting ready for actual publication than just fixing the publish box
yes. My question is separate, maybe I should open a new topic.

That would be good! I wrote a little script to do it in the end, but always
keen to look at alternatives!
